p: Levels of integrated proviral DNA in HIV-exposed LC5-RIC cultures treated with compound #7 were evaluated by Alu-PCR. Parallel assays were performed with two reference compounds that prevent HIV integration, the reverse transcriptase inhibitor Efavirenz (EFV), and the integrase inhibitor Dolutegravir (DTG). Treatment with either compound #7 or with reference drugs was performed at concentrations yielding full inhibition of infectious virus production (>2x IC 90). Treatment with EFV or DTG strongly reduced levels of integrated proviral DNA (>90%), confirming that our experimental conditions allow detection of compound-mediated reduction of proviral DNA levels (Fig.Â 3a). Furthermore, treatment with the HIV transcription inhibitor Flavopiridol (FLV) or the control compound #4 did not reveal reduction of proviral DNA levels, as expected.
